## Description

Several pages display JSON code blocks (payload previews, expanded rows), but the text color used varies:

| Location | Text Color | Background |
|----------|-----------|------------|
| Audit Logs (expanded row) | `text-green-400` | `bg-gray-900` |
| Content Browser (current data) | `text-green-400` | `bg-gray-900` |
| Payments (expanded row) | `text-green-400` | `bg-gray-900` |
| Approvals (data preview) | `text-gray-800 dark:text-green-400` | `bg-white dark:bg-gray-800` |
| Agent Sandbox (response) | `text-gray-100` | `bg-gray-800` |
| Schema Manager (schema editor) | `text-blue-900 dark:text-green-400` | `bg-gray-50 dark:bg-gray-900` |

### Issues:
1. **Approvals** shows light mode with dark text on white bg, but switches to green-on-dark — different from all other pages which are always dark-themed code blocks
2. **Agent Sandbox** uses `text-gray-100` instead of `text-green-400` for response JSON
3. **Schema Manager** uses `text-blue-900` in light mode, but all other code blocks use forced-dark (`bg-gray-900`) regardless of theme
4. Inconsistent border treatments: some have `border border-gray-700`, some have `shadow-inner`, some have both

## Recommendation

Standardize on one code block style. The most common pattern is:
```html
<div class="bg-gray-900 rounded-md overflow-hidden shadow-inner">
    <pre class="p-4 text-xs text-green-400 font-mono overflow-x-auto">
```

## Files affected
- `ui/src/routes/approvals/+page.svelte`
- `ui/src/routes/agent-sandbox/+page.svelte`
- `ui/src/routes/schema/+page.svelte`
title: UI: JSON code blocks use inconsistent text colors for dark mode

## Description

Both the **Payments** page and **Agent Sandbox** page contain nearly identical `deepParseJson` utility functions defined inline:

### Payments (`payments/+page.svelte:20-41`):
```ts
function deepParseJsonPayload(obj: any): any { ... }
```

### Agent Sandbox (`agent-sandbox/+page.svelte:18-39`):
```ts
function tryParseDeep(value: any): any { ... }
```

These are functionally identical — they recursively parse stringified JSON in objects. Meanwhile, `lib/utils.ts` already exports a `formatJson` utility that does something similar but for display formatting.

## Recommendation

Extract the deep-parse function into `lib/utils.ts` and import it from both pages:

```ts
// lib/utils.ts
export function deepParseJson(obj: any): any { ... }
```

## Files affected
- `ui/src/lib/utils.ts`
- `ui/src/routes/payments/+page.svelte`
- `ui/src/routes/agent-sandbox/+page.svelte`
title: UI: Duplicate deepParseJson utility in Payments and Agent Sandbox

## Description

The Dashboard and Audit Logs pages both display action badges (create/update/delete/rollback) but use different styling approaches:

### Dashboard (`+page.svelte`):
Uses Flowbite `<Badge>` component with semantic colors:
```svelte
<Badge color={actionColor} rounded>{event.action.toUpperCase()}</Badge>
```

### Audit Logs (`audit-logs/+page.svelte`):
Uses hand-crafted inline badge with explicit Tailwind classes:
```svelte
<span class="px-2 inline-flex text-xs leading-5 font-semibold rounded-full
    {row.action === 'create' ? 'bg-green-100 text-green-800 dark:bg-green-900/30 dark:text-green-400' : ...}">
```

### Content Browser (`content/+page.svelte`):
Status badges use yet another pattern:
```svelte
<span class="inline-flex items-center px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-[0.65rem] font-bold uppercase tracking-wider ...">
```

### Issues:
1. Three different badge implementations for the same concept
2. Dashboard uses `rounded` (pill) badges, Audit Logs uses `rounded-full`, Content uses `rounded`
3. Font sizes differ: `text-xs` vs `text-[0.65rem]`
4. Dark mode handling differs between Flowbite Badge and hand-crafted versions

## Recommendation

Create a shared `<StatusBadge>` component or consistently use Flowbite's `<Badge>` across all pages.

## Files affected
- `ui/src/routes/+page.svelte`
- `ui/src/routes/audit-logs/+page.svelte`
- `ui/src/routes/content/+page.svelte`
- `ui/src/routes/approvals/+page.svelte`
- `ui/src/routes/payments/+page.svelte`
title: UI: Action badge colors inconsistent between Dashboard and Audit Logs

## Description

The domain selector in the layout (`ui/src/routes/+layout.svelte:182-215`) is hardcoded to only show "Domain 1" and "Domain 2":

```svelte
{currentDomain === "1" ? "Domain 1" : "Domain 2"}

<DropdownItem on:click={() => selectDomain("1")}>Domain 1</DropdownItem>
<DropdownItem on:click={() => selectDomain("2")}>Domain 2</DropdownItem>
```

The backend supports an arbitrary number of domains via the `domains` table, but the UI has no way to:
1. Discover available domains dynamically
2. Display domains beyond ID 1 and 2
3. Show the actual domain name/hostname

Additionally, `DropdownItem` uses `on:click` (Svelte 4 event syntax) instead of `onclick` (Svelte 5), which is inconsistent with the rest of the layout that uses `onclick`.

## Recommendation
- Fetch domains from a `/domains` or `/api/domains` endpoint on mount
- Render the dropdown dynamically from the response
- Display the domain's `name` or `hostname` instead of "Domain 1"/"Domain 2"
- Replace `on:click` with `onclick`

## Files affected
- `ui/src/routes/+layout.svelte`
title: UI: Hardcoded domain selector only supports 2 domains

body:
## Description

The project uses **Svelte 5** (v5.51.0) with runes ($state, $derived, $effect, $props) throughout all pages. However, the **DataTable** component (`ui/src/lib/components/DataTable.svelte`) is written in the **Svelte 4 API**:

### Svelte 4 patterns in DataTable:
- `export let columns`, `export let data` — should be `let { columns, data, ... } = $props()`
- `type T = $$Generic<Record<string, any>>` — deprecated Svelte 4 generics syntax
- `createEventDispatcher()` — should use callback props in Svelte 5
- `<slot name="cell" let:row let:column>` — should use `{#snippet}` blocks
- `<slot name="expanded" let:row>` — same
- `<slot name="empty">` — same
- `let expandedRows = new Set()` — should use `$state`

### All other components use Svelte 5 patterns:
- **Toast.svelte**: Uses `feedbackStore` (runes-based)
- **ConfirmDialog.svelte**: Uses `$state`
- **All pages**: Use `$state`, `$derived`, `$effect`, `$props()`

### Consumer-side mismatch:
Pages using DataTable (Audit Logs, Keys, Payments) use the old `<svelte:fragment slot="cell" let:row let:column>` syntax to interface with it. Modernizing DataTable would let consumers use `{#snippet}` blocks instead.

## Impact
- Mixing Svelte 4 and 5 APIs in the same codebase
- `$$Generic` is deprecated and may break in future Svelte versions
- Slot-based API is less type-safe than snippet-based

## Files affected
- `ui/src/lib/components/DataTable.svelte`
- `ui/src/routes/audit-logs/+page.svelte` (consumer)
- `ui/src/routes/keys/+page.svelte` (consumer)
- `ui/src/routes/payments/+page.svelte` (consumer)
title: UI: DataTable uses legacy Svelte 4 slot API (export let, 89196Generic, slots)

## Description

The app imports and uses `svelte-hero-icons` (Icon component) in the layout/navbar for sidebar navigation, but almost every page uses **inline SVG icons** instead. This creates inconsistency and maintenance burden.

### Layout uses svelte-hero-icons:
```svelte
import { Icon } from "svelte-hero-icons";
import { Home, ClipboardDocumentList, Folder, ... } from "svelte-hero-icons";
<Icon src={item.icon} class="w-5 h-5 ..." />
```

### Pages use raw inline SVGs for the same concepts:
- **Refresh icon**: Hand-coded SVG in Audit Logs, Approvals, Keys (rotate arrow)
- **Close icon**: Hand-coded SVG in Content Browser, Keys modals (X mark)
- **Back arrow**: Hand-coded SVG in Content Browser, Approvals
- **Plus icon**: Hand-coded SVG in Keys, Schema Manager (add button)
- **Check icon**: Hand-coded SVG in Dashboard, Approvals
- **Trash icon**: Hand-coded SVG in Keys
- **Database icon**: Hand-coded SVG in Dashboard

All of these have equivalent hero-icons: `ArrowPath`, `XMark`, `ChevronLeft`, `Plus`, `Check`, `Trash`, `CircleStack`.

## Impact
- ~30+ inline SVGs that could be replaced with 1-line `<Icon>` calls
- Inconsistent icon sizing, stroke-width, and viewBox
- Harder to maintain or swap icon sets

## Recommendation
Replace inline SVGs with `<Icon src={...}>` across all pages to match the layout pattern.

## Files affected
All page files in `ui/src/routes/`
title: UI: Inline SVG icons used inconsistently alongside svelte-hero-icons library

## Description

The **Schema Manager** and **Agent Sandbox** pages use fixed `w-1/2` and `w-1/4` widths without responsive breakpoints, making them unusable on mobile and tablet screens.

### Schema Manager (`ui/src/routes/schema/+page.svelte`)
- Sidebar uses `w-1/4` without responsive hiding/toggle (no `md:` prefix)
- Editor split uses `w-1/2` columns that don't stack on mobile
- No mobile back-navigation button (unlike Content Browser and Approvals which have `md:hidden` back buttons)
- Compare with Content Browser which properly uses `w-full md:w-1/4` and `hidden md:flex` patterns

### Agent Sandbox (`ui/src/routes/agent-sandbox/+page.svelte`)
- Uses fixed `w-1/2` split for request/response panels
- On mobile, both panels render side-by-side and become unusably narrow
- Should stack vertically on small screens with `w-full md:w-1/2`

### Existing pattern that works (Content Browser):
```html
<div class="w-full md:w-1/4 ... {selectedType ? 'hidden md:flex' : 'flex'}">
```

This is already tracked partially in existing issues #45/#48 but those are about specific components. This issue tracks the two pages that have **no responsive layout at all**.

## Files affected
- `ui/src/routes/schema/+page.svelte`
- `ui/src/routes/agent-sandbox/+page.svelte`
title: UI: Schema Manager and Agent Sandbox lack responsive/mobile layout

## Summary

The UI codebase inconsistently uses Tailwind breakpoints. Most pages use `md:` (768px) as the primary mobile/desktop breakpoint, but some pages use `sm:` (640px) or mix both without clear intent.

## Examples

**Payments page** (`ui/src/routes/payments/+page.svelte`):
- Uses `sm:flex`, `sm:px-6`, `lg:px-8` — follows an `sm`/`lg` pattern

**Dashboard** (`ui/src/routes/+page.svelte`):
- Uses `grid-cols-2 md:grid-cols-5` — uses `md:` breakpoint

**Layout** (`ui/src/routes/+layout.svelte`):
- Uses `md:flex` for sidebar visibility — uses `md:` breakpoint

**Login** (`ui/src/routes/login/+page.svelte`):
- Uses `sm:px-6 lg:px-8` — uses `sm`/`lg` pattern

This creates a "no-man's land" between 640px and 768px where some components have switched to desktop layout while others haven't, causing a broken intermediate state on tablets.

## Suggested Fix

Standardize on a single primary breakpoint (recommend `md:` at 768px since the layout sidebar already uses it) and audit all pages for consistency. Use `sm:` only for fine-grained adjustments within the mobile layout, not for mobile/desktop switching.
title: Inconsistent responsive breakpoint usage across UI pages

## Summary

The audit log filter section (`ui/src/routes/audit-logs/+page.svelte`) uses fixed-width select elements (`w-40`, `w-48`) inside a `flex-wrap` container. On mobile, these fixed widths result in selects that are either too narrow (cutting off option text) or too wide (forcing awkward 1-per-row wrapping with wasted space).

## Details

The filter bar layout:
```html
<div class="... flex flex-wrap gap-4 items-end">
    <select class="... w-40 ...">  <!-- Entity Type -->
    <select class="... w-48 ...">  <!-- Action -->
    <input class="... w-40 ...">   <!-- Entity ID -->
```

On a 375px phone, two `w-40` (160px) selects with `gap-4` (16px) = 336px, which fits but leaves minimal margin. A `w-48` (192px) select won't pair on the same row, creating an inconsistent wrapping pattern.

## Suggested Fix

Use responsive widths:
```html
<select class="... w-full sm:w-40 ...">
<select class="... w-full sm:w-48 ...">
<input class="... w-full sm:w-40 ...">
```

This stacks filters vertically on mobile and returns to inline on larger screens.
title: Audit log filter controls don't adapt to mobile width

## Summary

The activity summary strip on the dashboard (`ui/src/routes/+page.svelte`, line 207) uses `grid-cols-2 md:grid-cols-5`:

```html
<div class="mb-8 grid grid-cols-2 md:grid-cols-5 gap-4">
```

With 5 items in a 2-column grid, the layout produces 2 rows of 2 items plus 1 orphaned item on the third row, creating an unbalanced visual.

## Suggested Fix

Use a single-column stack on the smallest screens:
```html
<div class="mb-8 grid grid-cols-1 sm:grid-cols-2 md:grid-cols-3 lg:grid-cols-5 gap-4">
```

This ensures clean stacking at every breakpoint.
title: Dashboard activity grid wraps awkwardly on mobile

## Summary

Modal dialogs in the Keys page and ConfirmDialog component use `max-w-md` (448px) without horizontal margin, causing them to overflow the viewport on phones narrower than 448px (most phones in portrait).

## Affected Components

### Keys modal (`ui/src/routes/keys/+page.svelte`, line 253-254)
```html
<div class="bg-white ... w-full max-w-md overflow-hidden ...">
```

### ConfirmDialog (`ui/src/lib/components/ConfirmDialog.svelte`, line 35-36)
```html
<div class="w-full max-w-md bg-white ... rounded-lg shadow-xl overflow-hidden ...">
```

Both modals render edge-to-edge on phones, with content touching (or exceeding) the screen edge. No horizontal breathing room.

## Suggested Fix

Add responsive margins to the modal container:
```html
<div class="w-full max-w-md mx-4 sm:mx-auto bg-white ...">
```

Or apply margins on the outer flex wrapper:
```html
<div class="fixed inset-0 ... flex items-center justify-center z-40 p-4">
```
title: Modal dialogs overflow on narrow phone screens

## Summary

The reusable `DataTable` component (`ui/src/lib/components/DataTable.svelte`) uses `px-6` (24px) padding on all table cells, which is excessive on mobile devices and causes text to compress or become illegible before horizontal scroll triggers.

## Details

**Header cells (line 64-65):**
```html
class="px-6 py-3 text-left text-xs font-medium ..."
```

**Body cells (line 148-149):**
```html
<td class="px-6 py-4 whitespace-nowrap text-sm ...">
```

This affects every page that uses DataTable: audit-logs, payments, keys, dashboard, and approvals.

On a 375px phone with 4+ columns, each cell gets ~70px of content width after padding — not enough for most data.

## Suggested Fix

Use responsive padding:
```html
<!-- Header -->
class="px-3 sm:px-4 md:px-6 py-3 ..."

<!-- Body -->
class="px-3 sm:px-4 md:px-6 py-3 md:py-4 ..."
```

Optionally, consider a card-based layout for narrow viewports as a longer-term improvement.
title: DataTable cell padding too large for mobile viewports

## Summary

Two major pages use hardcoded fractional widths (`w-1/2`, `w-1/4`) without responsive breakpoints, making them completely unusable on mobile devices.

## Affected Pages

### Schema Editor (`ui/src/routes/schema/+page.svelte`)

**Line 251-254:** The sidebar uses `w-1/4` (25% width) with no responsive override:
```html
<div class="flex-1 flex gap-6 overflow-hidden">
    <div class="w-1/4 bg-white ...">
```

**Line ~368:** The editor area uses two `w-1/2` columns side-by-side:
```html
<div class="flex-1 overflow-y-auto p-6 flex gap-6">
    <div class="w-1/2 flex flex-col gap-4">
    <div class="w-1/2 flex flex-col gap-4">
```

On a 375px phone, the sidebar becomes 94px wide and each editor column becomes ~175px — both are unreadable.

### Agent Sandbox (`ui/src/routes/agent-sandbox/+page.svelte`)

**Line 306-309:** Request/response panes are `w-1/2` with `min-h-[600px]`:
```html
<div class="flex flex-1 gap-6 overflow-hidden min-h-[600px]">
    <div class="w-1/2 flex flex-col ...">
    <div class="w-1/2 flex flex-col ...">
```

On mobile this creates two ~170px wide columns with a forced 600px minimum height — unusable.

## Suggested Fix

Both pages should use `flex-col md:flex-row` and `w-full md:w-1/2` patterns:

```html
<!-- Schema editor -->
<div class="flex-1 flex flex-col md:flex-row gap-4 md:gap-6 overflow-hidden">
    <div class="w-full md:w-1/4 ...">

<!-- Agent sandbox -->
<div class="flex flex-col md:flex-row flex-1 gap-4 md:gap-6 overflow-hidden md:min-h-[600px]">
    <div class="w-full md:w-1/2 ...">
```
title: Schema editor and Agent Sandbox layouts break on mobile

## Summary
Running `npm run check` in `ui/` surfaces an accessibility warning in `ConfirmDialog.svelte`.

## Warning
- File: `ui/src/lib/components/ConfirmDialog.svelte:35`
- Warning: `Elements with the 'dialog' interactive role must have a tabindex value`

## Reproduction
1. `cd ui`
2. `npm run check`
3. Observe Svelte a11y warning for `role="dialog"` container.

## Expected
Dialog surfaces should satisfy baseline accessibility requirements (focusable container, keyboard navigation, and predictable focus management).

## Actual
Dialog is rendered with `role="dialog"` but lacks `tabindex` (and currently suppresses some static interaction warnings on overlay click handling).

## Suggested fix
1. Add `tabindex="-1"` to the dialog container.
2. Move initial focus into dialog on open (confirm or cancel button) and restore focus on close.
3. Keep overlay-click close behavior, but ensure keyboard escape and focus trap are supported.
4. Optionally enforce this in CI by running `npm run check` for `ui/` (or equivalent warning gate).
title: UI accessibility warning: ConfirmDialog role=dialog is not focusable
